reviewText:
Since the Romine Brothers decided to release this game and Starship: Nova Strike early, following my livestream with Mellow_Online1 yesterday, it's time for a post-release review.

Now I was willing to give them the benefit of the doubt as to the bugs and problems we found with Krog Wars yesterday, I've checked the game since and found that they have not. The exploit is still present, and really should be fixed, as well as the 3D/2D switching bug between successive playthroughs. The controls need tighenerd considerably, amongst a laundry list of other problems.

The pre-release review of the game that was made yesterday stands.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=h_CCsNv9NUM

The material for Krog Wars starts about half an hour in.

Also note that the General Discussions forum has been hidden unless you already own the game, after which point it's entirely too late for the pre-release review (which was moved there) to be of any use to you. This is an even more underhanded attempt at censorship than they've engaged in previously. If you've bought this game, I recommend you return it immediately.

If they fix the bugs and address the other issues exposed in the video, it might be okay-ish. Nothing special or spectacular, but at least okay. As it is now it's a snarled mess, representative of the name Digital Homicide has made for themselves over the last couple of years. Avoid like the plague.

reviewText:
‚Ä¢ Pausing the game causes attacking enemies to freeze in place, trivializing their threat

‚Ä¢ However, pausing the game does not always freeze enemies that are at the top of the screen

‚Ä¢ Sometimes levels will randomly complete before all of the enemies have been defeated

‚Ä¢ Other times levels won't complete even after defeating all of the enemies

‚Ä¢ No in-game options for sound or graphics (though there are graphic options in the launcher)

‚Ä¢ No tutorial explaining how certain game mechanics work such as the KrogMart or the advertised 2D/3D mode

‚Ä¢ Upgrades don't seem to do much of anything (though I admit I didn't get far because the game softlocked)

‚Ä¢ Wonky hitboxes can often cause you to get hit by projectiles or enemies nowhere near your ship, which is made more troublesome by the invisible barriers on the sides of the screen present in higher resolutions

‚Ä¢ Game Over doesn't take you back to the title screen, but to the Digital Homicide Proudly Presents" splash screen (which you can skip with Esc)

‚Ä¢ Once you're at the title screen
date:
there's no way to exit other than Alt+F4 or Alt+Tabbing out and then closing it through Task Manager

‚Ä¢ Uninstalling Krog Wars left several files on my computer which my anti-virus software kindly flagged and deleted for me

I was legimitately curious if DigiHom was as bad as I had heard
recommended: but after playing this it definitely feels like something they spent a few hours on then threw onto Steam to make a quick buck. If you don't believe me
hoursPlayed: just look at their two most recent Greenlight submissions which are nearly identical.\n\nEDIT: Before I received my refund I tried pressing every key on my keyboard and found out that Tab switches 2D/3D perspective (and is absolutely nauseating) and that Space fires your missiles."

reviewText:
Well what can I tell you about this game that you wouldn't say just by looking at screenshots ? Not much so it will be really short.
This is you another space shooter in old Space Invaders fashion. I'm sure you do remember or heard about this game released in mid 80s . Then tons of them got released over the years and here you got another one. Only that we have now 2016 not 1985 and you have tons of games like this available for free in your browser and some of them are made really good. And this one is NOT. This is extremely poor game with close to none differences between stages, garbage graphics, lazy music, sluggish and awkward controls.
In few words : This is yet another crappy game made with UNITY engine (hearing this already suppose to make you not buying the game) by company that is still making tons of garbage just to make few bucks here and there selling it in bundles, making few bucks on cards and so on. Game without any real value. Experiencing it makes Bad Rats looking like an AAA title...
FrankCastle51 out !

reviewText:
The stream I did with Kage, playing the original itch.io versions of Krog Wars & Starship: Nova Strike:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=h_CCsNv9NUM

I'm going to try my best to keep this review calm and collected and not insult Digital Homicide.

Me and Kage reviewed the versions that DH put up onto itch.io and me and Kage criticised the amount of problems these 2 games had and we hve reasons to believe that DH actually saw that stream but I'm not going to go into detail about tht here, check out the link here for more info about this

So anyway, since they saw our stream, and sine the games had 1 week before the release of Starship and 2 weeks before Krog Wars, we assumed that they would actually fix the issues that we cought on stream, but they didn't, they changed f*ck all.

I had high hopes for this one as I was thinking that DH couldn't mess up a game like this but they proved me wrong. Problems which I never thought could be in this sort of game is in it.

You just shoot enemies in a 2D/3D environment which you can adjust at will but it takes you a while to figure out which key actually does this because the game doesn't show any sort of instructions of what you need to do.

Like I said before, all of the problems that me and Kage covered in the live stream, are still present in the final version. The controls are bad no matter whether you play in the 2D or 3D mode. In the 2D mode, the controls are slippery and when you‚Äôre in the 3D mode, the controls seem restricted.The pause menu glitch that I showed in the live stream, is again still present and this was a near game breaking glitch. They still give off the idea that they made this game in a small resolution because I play on 1920x1080 screen and half of my screen was restricted on each side, only covered up by a jpeg google image of space. The enemy ships just seemed to be magnetised to the front of your ship as it just follows you and they only come one at a time. The pause menu doesn‚Äôt pause a game during boss fights either. The pause menu works on all the stages except for the boss,it pauses the ordinary enemies but doesn‚Äôt pause the boss itself. Also if you‚Äôre playing in 3D mode and try to pause the game during a boss fight, the pause menu glitches and the pause menu goes above action, blocking off nearly any view you have of the enemies. The reason for this is because the game still thinks it‚Äôs running in the 2D mode and Digital Homicide didn‚Äôt make a pause menu that was compatible with the 3D mode so they just made you switch back to 2D mode in order to pause the game and it still doesn‚Äôt fully pause because the spaceships and bosses still shoot.

Please Digital Homicide, actually listen to me now because you ignored us on the stream, please take your time, if you make a good game and take your time with it, people will enjoy i more and send less hate your way. Take your time.

My curator group: http://steamcommunity.com/groups/MellowReviews

reviewText:
GO F*** YOURSELF DIGITAL HOMICIDE AND F*** VALVE'S IGNORANCE FOR ACTUALLY GREENLIGHTING A GAME SO TERRIBLE LOOKING. If I was in charge of Greenlight then a Digital Homicide game would NEVER get a game Greenlit again. All Digital Homicide does is spam sh**** games onto Steam and tries to make money off of these sh**** games. It's completly and utterly ridiculous and the the Steam community would like Digital Homicide to f*** right off. This game is terrible and Digital Homicide is an absolutely terrible company that Valve needs to ban from Greenlight so we can finally get some peace and quiet on Steam.

Onto the game. It's Space Invaders except it's much easier than Space Invaders which makes it incredibly boring. The game has no substance to it and it's just shoot shoot shoot until you feel your brain cells pop. This game is so boring that I played for only 4 minutes until I was just too bored to play any further. On top of being boring the game is also an asset flip and a fairly obvious one. You can tell that DigiHom did not make any of the sprites and the programming looks poorly done. Of course DigiHom has already had terrible programming with their games.

Digital Homicide needs to stop making games because they really suck at it and I will obviously be requesting a refund due to how terrible this game is. If DigiHom wants to be successful in the video game industry then they could start by not being the most hated video game company of all time and actually make a game that's worth playing. Digital Homicide sucks and all their games suck.

Digital Homicide proudly presents" is the first text you see on screen. There's absolutely nothing in this game to feel proud of. In fact
date: Digital Homicide should feel ashamed that they made something so terrible. I think we can all agree that Digital Homicide can go f*** themselves."

reviewText:
Ok so this is a more colorful version of space invaders. It's not all bad, I'd even have to say it's better than the other Digital Homicide games I tried (not that they were any good but still this can be considered not too bad).
Controls respond well, the sound track is decent...But it's still just space invaders.
As for theupgrades the game never explains about how to get them. Actually unless you read the game description you never would know about upgrades. Just hit esc while playing and the "upgrade shop" will open. But the game goes on on the background and you still take damage and can even die while buying upgrades.

reviewText:
Krog Wars is a game that I can't recommend because:
- the price is too much for it's quality (if it has one)
- it has bugs
- it needs to be worked on it a lot to deserve even 1 euro
- it has no story
- there are no in-game options for sound or graphics
- it doesn't have a tutorial
- the only good reason to install this game is for the trading cards

reviewText:
Play! Die! Repeat!
Edge of Gaming!

Here it comes! The game that we all have been waiting for! Digital Homicide Studios' new masterpiece (of cra*p)!

After failing at ripping off the most important genres in the video game industy such as platformers, dungeon crawlers, first person shooter, pac man style arcade games and more, Digital Homicide goes even further by ripping off Space Invaders and Galaxian, two games that defined the shoot'em up genre in the late 70's.

Krog Wars may look a little appealing" during the first 5 minutes of gameplay but beyond that it gets boring really fast. The "journey" consist of nothing but three waves : regular wave
date: bonus round and boss round. Once you kill the boss you just repeat the same thing over and over until you die with little to no variety.\n\nAside from gameplay
recommended: you can see in my video how unoptimized the game is. During my 5 minutes playthrough I experienced some freezes during wave transition as well as framerate drops when killing "too much" enemies.\n\nWhile this may be not be the worst game in Digital Homicide's curriculum
hoursPlayed: it is surely a good contenter for Worst Greenlight Game of the Year. Since 2016 has just started

in this short amount of time, I am positive i have seen all there is to see in Krog wars.
When i was in fifth grade, i decided to mess with Game Maker, specifically the  Scrolling Shooter tutorial. Being the overachiever i was, i reskinned the game and made horrible design choces to change up the game.
Why do i bring this up? because Krog Wars is 10 year old JDude's \masterpiece"
date: made in unity. Enemies that home in without any sort of pattern? check. Bullets offset from thier creation
recommended: making them look as if they appear at random? bingo. Complete looping with no changes
hoursPlayed: besides a few extra minigames in between. Bravo.\nDH/10\n(not even a 0/10 would describe how simultaneously lazy and boring this game is)"
